intro: Basanacantha wittii, commonly known as the Witt's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Basanacantha wittii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
